ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the basics of Chemistry and this class made me like science even more. I am currently an MCDB major, but I'm kind of considering a Chemistry major now.
Balancing equations, reactions, and basic chemistry knowledge.
Dujrign this course I was able to learn more in depth how chemsitry works while having the resources I need to be able to excel in the class
Basic chemistry topics like stoichiometry, enthalpy stuff, lewis structures.
It was a great review of the material learnt in AP Chemistry and some topics were taught in more depth.
This course taught me the introductory information of general chemistry, in such a way where the lessons taught could be applied in a lab setting.
I gained an expansive basis in general chemistry. I learned how to attend office hours and develop connections with professors.
Test taking skills; this was my first official final class and I felt prepared

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: great overall foundation to chemistry. I really enjoyed getting to learn a bit about a lot of things.

Weakness: Often we rushed into doing example problems before I (and I think my classmates) really understood the material conceptually. I think shifting the balance to spend a bit more time of the conceptual portion of the content (what was happening, why it was happening, where it happens in the real world, why it is important) would help me feel stronger going into example problems.

The way this course was taught was very efficient. The lectures and short homework assignments were very effective in understanding the material before the exams, but luckily it also didn't take too much time out of my day to complete.

I appreciated the homework assignments being after every lecture instead of one problem set as I was able to cement my in class knowledge better. The questions on the examinations were much harder than the practice exams, which I found frustrating.

The strengths of the course was that the topics where very well explained in class and where taught at a good speed. One thing that I wish I had better access to was the explanation of the extra practice problems for each lesson.
It didn't seem like we had enough homework, which made the actual learning very independent.
The course was my favorite out of the courses I've taken so far.

This course had the most online resources out of all my courses to further reinforce what was taught during lectures. The professor was easy to understand and her teaching method was one that allowed for the easiest comprehension on my part.

Strengths: canvas had so much valuable information that was great for studying, the layout of the course material was spread out quite nice and it was easily charted on canvas. 
Weaknesses: the discussions were not immensely helpful to me. I prefer office hours.

Strengths: Small section and great student to teacher interaction. Content was easy to understand, and if not there was also help

Weaknesses: none

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to anyone looking to fulfill their general chemistry requirements without a strong background in chemistry.

Definitely take this class if you need it for your major and/or are interesting in chemistry. I really liked the format of this class and I kind of enjoyed putting effort into something I found beneficial for my future career. Also, hard work always pays off in this class, which is very nice.
I would not recommend this class unless it is required for your major.
I would recommend this course to another student. The class was a good size, and I was able to learn really well in class. I loved learning the various topics we had covered in class.
Yes, if you are able to work independently and understand topics fairly fast, because it is pretty fast paced
Yes I would strongly recommend, the professor was excellent and the policies and requirements of the class were very reasonable.

I would recommend this course; should a student have the opportunity to take on this exclusive section of CHEM 161, I feel it is well worth it. The course is taught well, has many resources to learn the material and seek help, and has a smaller class size to allow for a better connection with the professor and ask questions.
I recommend the smaller class than the larger lecture its more personalized but doesn't have as a big of a curve
Absolutely. This is a great intro course
